lead_paragraph: Protests inspired by social media turned violent outside a rally in San Jose, Calif., the result of a combustible mix of the candidate’s fiery oratory and the passion of the anti-Trump movement.

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti reported from Redding, Calif., and Alan Rappeport reported from Washington. John Corrales contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By ALAN RAPPEPORT and NICK CORASANITI

headline.print_headline: Trump’s California Rallies Attract Passion and Unrest
headline.main: Anti-Trump Voices Amplify on Internet, With Violent Results

snippet: Protests inspired by social media turned violent outside a rally in San Jose, Calif., the result of a combustible mix of the candidate’s fiery oratory and the passion of the anti-Trump movement.
abstract: Donald Trump criticizes protesters who showed up at campaign rally in San Jose in demonstration against candidate and his supporters; protest, which turned violent, appears to have sprung up spontaneously at urging of independent local efforts on social media.
